Title: Temporary Closure of Identified Sri Lanka Missions / Posts Overseas: High Commission of Sri Lanka in Abuja/Nigeria, Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt/Germany, Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Nicosia/Cyprus
Summary: The Foreign Ministry has decided to temporarily close three of its Missions/Posts overseas: the High Commission of Sri Lanka in Abuja, Nigeria; the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt, Germany; and the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Nicosia, Cyprus.

Title: The message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa President of Sri Lanka for Christmas 2021
Summary: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered a Christmas message for 2021. The message was shared on WhatsApp and included greetings for the occasion.

Title: ​MoU between Sri Lanka and Iran ‘Tea for Oil’ Barter Arrangement
Summary: Sri Lanka and Iran signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for a 'Tea for Oil' barter arrangement. The agreement was between the Ministry of Plantation of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Industries, Mine, and Trade of Iran.

Title: Social media reports on a Sri Lankan national in Kuwait
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Kuwait is aware of circulating social media video clips involving Sri Lankan national Krishnan Siriyanie Chandralatha. The embassy is investigating the matter to gather and provide necessary assistance.

Title: ​Foreign Minister Peiris meets Envoys of 17 countries after their presentation of credentials
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L Peiris met with newly appointed envoys from 17 countries at the Foreign Ministry on December 22. The meeting took place after the envoys presented their credentials to President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. This engagement aimed to strengthen diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and the represented countries.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Kingdom of Spain to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Kingdom of Spain, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Jose Maria Dominguez as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Spain to Sri Lanka. Mr. Dominguez will represent Spain in his new role in Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Tunisia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Tunisia, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Ms. Hayet Talbi Bilel as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Tunisia to Sri Lanka. Ms. Bilel will represent Tunisia in Sri Lanka in her new role.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Slovenia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Slovenia, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Ms. Mateja Ghosh as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Slovenia to Sri Lanka. Ms. Ghosh will represent Slovenia in Sri Lanka in her new diplomatic role.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Republic of Sierra Leone to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Sierra Leone, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Ernest Mbaimba Ndomahina as the inaugural High Commissioner of Sierra Leone to Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Federal Republic of Nigeria to Sri Lanka
Summary: Mr. Ahmed Sule has been appointed as the High Commissioner of the Federal Republic of Nigeria to Sri Lanka, based in New. The appointment was made with the concurrence of the Government of Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the of Republic of Rwanda to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Rwanda, in agreement with Sri Lanka, has appointed Ms. Mukangira Jacqueline as the High Commissioner of Rwanda to Sri Lanka. She will be based in New Delhi.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Islamic Republic of Mauritania to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Islamic Republic of Mauritania, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Muhammad Ahmad Rara as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mr. Rara will represent Mauritania in his new role.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Republic of Malta to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Malta, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Reuben Gauci as the High Commissioner of Malta to Sri Lanka. He will be stationed in New Delhi for his diplomatic role.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, with the agreement of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Mohammed El-Kayed as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. He will represent Jordan in diplomatic matters between the two countries.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Dominican Republic to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Dominican Republic, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. David Emmanuel Puig as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Dominican Republic to Sri Lanka. Mr. Puig will represent the Dominican Republic in Sri Lanka in his new role.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of Democratic People’s Republic of Korea to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea, with the concurrence of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Choe Hui Chol as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mr. Chol will represent the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea in Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Indonesia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Indonesia, with the concurrence of Sri Lanka, has appointed Ms. Dewi Gustina Tobing as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Indonesia to Sri Lanka. Ms. Tobing will represent Indonesia in diplomatic relations with Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Arab Republic of Egypt to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Arab Republic of Egypt, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Maged Mosleh as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Egypt to Sri Lanka. Mr. Mosleh will represent Egypt in Sri Lanka in his diplomatic capacity.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Cooperative Republic of Guyana to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Cooperative Republic of Guyana, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Charrandass Persaud as the High Commissioner of Guyana to Sri Lanka. This appointment strengthens diplomatic relations between the two countries.

Title: ​Appointment of Ambassador of Hungary to Sri Lanka
Summary: Hungary has appointed Mr. Andras Laszlo Kiraly as its Ambassador to Sri Lanka, with the approval of the Sri Lankan government. He will serve as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Hungary to Sri Lanka, based in New Delhi.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the of Republic of Botswana to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Botswana, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Gilbert Shimane Mangole as the new High Commissioner of Botswana to Sri Lanka. Mr. Mangole will be based in New Delhi for his diplomatic duties.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Argentine Republic to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Argentine Republic, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Hugo Javier Gobbi as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Argentine Republic to Sri Lanka. Mr. Gobbi will represent Argentina in diplomatic matters in Sri Lanka.

Title: ​Australian Home Minister holds wide ranging talks with the Foreign Minister Peiris
Summary: Australian Home Affairs Minister Karen Andrews held extensive discussions with Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris during her official visit on December 20, 2021. The talks focused on exploring opportunities for increased cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris discusses progress in achieving Sustainable Development Goals with UN Assistant Secretary General Kanni Wignaraja
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris discussed progress in achieving Sustainable Development Goals with UN Assistant Secretary General Kanni Wignaraja, who is also the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) Assistant Administrator and Director of the UNDP Regional Bureau for Asia and the Pacific. Their meeting focused on collaborative efforts towards sustainable development goals.

Title: ​The High Commissioner of India meets Foreign Minister
Summary: The High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka, Gopal Baglay, met with Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris at the Foreign Ministry to discuss the progress of ongoing bilateral engagements between the two countries.

Title: Foreign Minister Peiris hands over a financial grant to the family of  late Priyantha Kumara
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L Peiris handed over a financial grant to the family of late Priyantha Kumara, who was brutally killed by a mob in Sialkot, Pakistan. The event took place at the Foreign Ministry today, offering support to the grieving family.

Title: ​Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris hosts Year-end Christmas reception 2021
Summary: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris hosted a Year-end Christmas reception on December 12, 2021, at the Hilton Colombo. The event was attended by Heads of Missions of the Diplomatic Corps based in Colombo, Cabinet Ministers, MPs, and senior government officials.

Title: ​Polish Ambassador calls on Foreign Minister
Summary: Polish Ambassador Adam Burakowski, also accredited to Sri Lanka, met with Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on December 8, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry to discuss mutual interests.

Title: ​Foreign Minister G. L. Peiris reassures commitment of Sri Lanka to BIMSTEC during the visit of Secretary General of BIMSTEC Tenzin Lekphell
Summary: During the visit of BIMSTEC Secretary General Tenzin Lekphell, Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister G. L. Peiris reaffirmed the country's commitment to BIMSTEC. The Secretary General briefed the Foreign Minister during a courtesy call.

Title: Speech for Hon. Foreign Minister (Head of Delegation) 2021 Seoul UN Peacekeeping Ministerial 7-8 December, 2021. Session I: Sustaining Peace
Summary: At the 2021 Seoul UN Peacekeeping Ministerial on December 7-8, H.E. Chung Eui-yong, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea, delivered a speech on sustaining peace. He expressed appreciation to attendees and emphasized the importance of collaborative efforts in maintaining global peace.

Title: Foreign Minister discusses with the Pakistan envoy in Sri Lanka matters relating to financial security of the family of late Priyantha Kumara
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G L Peiris met with Pakistan's Acting High Commissioner Tanvir Ahmad in Colombo to discuss financial security for the family of the late Priyantha Kumara. They deliberated on matters related to compensation during the meeting.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. Peiris discusses  Energy  Security, Increased Employment Opportunities with UAE Foreign Minister
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris discussed energy security and increased employment opportunities with UAE Foreign Minister Sheikh Abdulla Bin Zayed Al Nahyan at the 5th Indian Ocean Conference – IOC 2021. The meeting took place on the sidelines of the conference.

Title: Minister of External Affairs of India calls on Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris met with Minister of External Affairs of India Dr. S. Jaishankar at the 5th Indian Ocean Conference in Abu Dhabi. They discussed bilateral relations between Sri Lanka and India during the meeting.

Title: The human remains of   Diyawadanage Don Nandasiri Priyantha Kumara to be brought to Sri Lanka tomorrow
Summary: The human remains of Diyawadanage Don Nandasiri Priyantha Kumara, who was killed by a mob in Sialkot, Pakistan on December 3, 2021, will be brought to Sri Lanka on December 6, 2021, via Sri Lankan Airlines.

Title: Swedish Ambassador calls on Foreign Minister
Summary: Swedish Ambassador Klas Molin, concurrently accredited to Sri Lanka from New Delhi, met with Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on December 2, 2021. They discussed matters of mutual interest at the Foreign Ministry.

Title: Ambassador of Japan to Sri Lanka MIZUKOSHI Hideaki called on Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris
Summary: The newly appointed Japanese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, MIZUKOSHI Hideaki, paid a courtesy call on Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on 30 November 2021. The Foreign Minister warmly welcomed the new Ambassador, strengthening diplomatic ties between Japan and Sri Lanka.

Title: Sri Lanka Missions to Accelerate Tourism Promotion
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris, Tourism Minister Prasanna Ranatunga, and State Minister Tharaka Balasuriya addressed the country's Heads of Mission abroad to boost tourism promotion efforts. The officials discussed strategies to accelerate tourism promotion during the meeting.

Title: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris hosts working dinner for Ambassadors of Islamic States
Summary: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris hosted a working dinner for the Ambassadors of Islamic States in Colombo on 30 November, with Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa as the Guest of Honour. The event aimed to strengthen diplomatic ties and cooperation between Sri Lanka and the Islamic countries.

Title: United Nations Special Rapporteur calls on Foreign Minister
Summary: The United Nations Special Rapporteur on Contemporary Forms of Slavery, Tomoya Obokata, is visiting Sri Lanka at the government's invitation. He has called on the Foreign Minister during his visit.

Title: Ambassador Unambuwe presents Credentials to President Pendarovski of the Republic of North Macedonia
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Germany, Manori Unambuwe, presented her Letters of Credence to President Stevo Pendarovski of North Macedonia, officially accrediting her as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary. This formalizes her role as the ambassador representing Sri Lanka in North Macedonia.

Title: Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka Ambassador C. A. Chaminda I. Colonne presents Letters of Credence to the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (UNESCAP)
Summary: Ambassador C. A. Chaminda I. Colonne, the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (UNESCAP), presented his Letters of Credence. This formalized his role in representing Sri Lanka at UNESCAP.

Title: Chargé d’affaires of the United Arab Emirates to Sri Lanka Ibrahim Ali Ibrahim Al Gergawi calls on Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka Prof. G.L. Peiris
Summary: Chargé d'affaires of the United Arab Emirates to Sri Lanka, Ibrahim Ali Ibrahim Al Gergawi, met with Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on November 26, 2021. During the meeting, the Chargé d'affaires conveyed greetings from the Minister of Foreign Affairs.

Title: Dutch Ambassador presents “Orange the World” Banner to Foreign Minister
Summary: The Dutch Ambassador, Tanja Gonggrijp, presented the "Orange the World" banner to the Foreign Minister in Colombo to mark the annual "Orange the World: 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence" campaign.

Title: Foreign Minister stresses importance of collaboration at University of Colombo Annual Research Symposium 2021
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris emphasized the importance of collaboration at the University of Colombo Annual Research Symposium 2021, where he was the Special Guest on November 23. The symposium gathered distinguished academics to share their research findings and insights.

Title: United Nations ASG Khaled Khiari calls on Foreign Minister
Summary: United Nations Assistant-Secretary-General Khaled Khiari, visiting Sri Lanka, met with Foreign Minister Prof G.L. Peiris on Tuesday.

Title: Italian Ambassador calls on Foreign Minister
Summary: The Ambassador of Italy to Sri Lanka, Rita Manella, met with Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on November 22, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry. The discussion centered on mutual interests, including political relations. The meeting aimed to strengthen ties between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore facilitates donation of Covid-19 medical equipment
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore helped facilitate a donation of 50 BiPAP machines and 8 ventilators from the Temasek Foundation of Singapore to support Sri Lanka's COVID-19 containment efforts. This donation aims to bolster Sri Lanka's healthcare system during the pandemic.

Title: Public Notice
Summary: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is seeking the public's assistance in locating close relatives or acquaintances of Sri Lankans who have passed away abroad. If you have any information, please come forward to help with the identification process.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Austria facilitates donation of Covid-19 medical equipment
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Austria helped coordinate a donation of Covid-19 medical equipment, including rapid antigen test kits and pulse oximeters. The donation was made by the Honorary Consuls of Sri Lanka in Styria and Carinthia in Austria, the Czech Republic, Serbia, and Slovakia.

Title: Ambassador N.L Godfrey Cooray presents Credentials to the President of Iceland
Summary: Ambassador N.L. Godfrey Cooray presented his Letter of Credence to President Guðni Th. Jóhannesson of Iceland at a ceremony on November 10, 2021, in Reykjavík. The ceremony took place at the office of the President of Iceland, accrediting Ambassador Cooray.

Title: “Sri Lanka improved its global ranking in SDGs despite global pandemic”: Foreign Secretary tells the 5th South Asia Forum on Sustainable Development Goals
Summary: During the 5th South Asia Forum on Sustainable Development Goals in Colombo, Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage announced that Sri Lanka has enhanced its global ranking in SDGs despite the global pandemic. This positive development was highlighted in his keynote address on Tuesday.

Title: Assuming the Vice Chair of IORA Foreign Minister Peiris Calls for Collective Action to Safeguard Maritime Shipping Lanes and Ocean Space from Pollution related Disasters at the 21st Council of Ministers Meeting in Dhaka
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris assumed the Vice-Chair position of the Indian Ocean Rim Association at the 21st Council of Ministers Meeting in Dhaka. He called for collective action to safeguard maritime shipping lanes and ocean space from pollution-related disasters.

Title: Seva Vanitha Unit of Sri Lanka Mission in Geneva donates Covid-19 medical equipment
Summary: The Seva Vanitha Unit of the Sri Lanka Mission in Geneva, with the support of staff members and spouses, raised funds through various activities and donated 8 Oxygen Concentrators for government use in combating Covid-19.

Title: Foreign Minister G. L. Peiris calls on Prime Minister of Bangladesh
Summary: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris met with Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina at her office in Dhaka, Bangladesh. During the meeting, Prof. Peiris briefed the Prime Minister on Sri Lanka's successful initiatives.

Title: Donation to Itukama Covid-19 Healthcare and Social Security Fund from Philippines
Summary: Philippine businessman William Chen, a friend of Sri Lanka, donated $20,000 (approximately Rs. 4 million) to the Itukama Covid-19 Healthcare and Social Security Fund. The generous contribution aims to support the country's efforts in combating the pandemic.

Title: Foreign Minister Peiris discusses further collaboration in shipping sector with Bangladesh
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof G.L. Peiris discussed further collaboration in the shipping sector with State Minister of Shipping Khalid Mahmud Chowdhury of Bangladesh on November 16. This meeting followed his previous discussion with Bangladesh's Foreign Minister Dr. to strengthen ties between the two countries.

Title: US DASS Kelly Keiderling reviews bilateral ties with the Foreign Secretary
Summary: US Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Public Diplomacy, Ambassador Kelly Keiderling, reviewed bilateral ties with the Foreign Secretary. The discussions covered a wide range of topics related to bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Kingdom of Thailand to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Thailand, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Poj Harnpol as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mr. Harnpol will represent Thailand in diplomatic matters in Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Republic of South Africa to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of South Africa, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Sandile Edwin Schalk as the High Commissioner of the Republic of South Africa to Sri Lanka. Mr. Schalk will serve in this role in Succes.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of Japan to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Japan, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Hideaki Mizukoshi as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Japan to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. Akira Sug.

Title: Germany donates 300,000 Rapid Antigen Test Kits
Summary: The Ministry of Social Affairs, Health, and Integration of the German State of Baden-Württemberg donated 300,000 German-manufactured Rapid Antigen Test Kits to support Sri Lanka's efforts in containing COVID-19. This donation aims to bolster Sri Lanka's testing capabilities and enhance its response to the pandemic.

Title: BIMSTEC Secretary General Tenzin Lekphell pays a Courtesy Call on Foreign Minister Peiris in Dhaka
Summary: BIMSTEC Secretary General Tenzin Lekphell paid a courtesy call on Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris in Dhaka. They discussed matters related to the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC).

Title: Foreign Minister Peiris meets Foreign Minister of Bangladesh
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris met with Bangladesh's Foreign Minister Dr. A.K. Abdul Momen at the State Guest House Padma in Dhaka on November 15. During the meeting, Foreign Minister Peiris recalled the visit of Prime Minister Mahin.

Title: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris to attend 21st Meeting of IORA Council of Ministers in Dhaka
Summary: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris will visit Dhaka, Bangladesh from November 15 to 18, 2021, to attend the 21st Meeting of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) Council of Ministers.

Title: Sri Lanka brings the importance of sustainable nitrogen management to the climate change discourse
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Ministry hosted an event titled 'Rediscovering Nitrogen: Solution synergies for climate change, health, biodiversity, and circular economy' in collaboration with the International Nitrogen Management System. The event aimed to highlight the significance of sustainable nitrogen management in addressing climate change and promoting environmental sustainability.

Title: Foreign Minister bids farewell to Ambassador of Japan
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris bid farewell to Ambassador Akira Sugiyama of Japan at the Foreign Ministry today. The Minister highlighted the strong and multifaceted relations between the two countries.

Title: Ambassador Manori Unambuwe Presents Credentials to the President of the Republic of Montenegro
Summary: Ambassador Manori Unambuwe presented her Letters of Credence to President Milo Đukanović of Montenegro at the Presidential Palace in Cetinje, officially accrediting her as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary. This ceremony marks the beginning of her diplomatic mission in Montenegro.

Title: The Royal Audience and the Presentation of the Letter of Credence  by Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne to the King Maha Vajiralongkorn Phra Vajiraklaochaoyuhua of the Kingdom of Thailand
Summary: Ambassador C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne of Sri Lanka presented his Letter of Credence to King Maha Vajiralongkorn Phra Vajiraklaochaoyuhua of Thailand during a Royal Audience. The King graciously received the Ambassador as the official representative of Sri Lanka.

Title: Sri Lankan Envoy to Saudi Arabia Presents Copies of Credentials
Summary: Sri Lankan Ambassador designate P.M. Amza presented copies of credentials to Saudi Arabia's Deputy Minister for Protocol Affairs, Khalid bin Faisal Al Sihly on November 2, 2021, at the Ministry.

Title: Message by Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka on the occasion of Deepavali
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa of Sri Lanka shared a message on the occasion of Deepavali. The message was conveyed via a WhatsApp image dated November 4, 2021, at 10:03 AM.

Title: Speech by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa at the “ World Leaders Summit of COP26″, UN Climate Change Conference, Scotland,  UK | 01 November 2021
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa emphasized the critical importance of addressing climate change at the "World Leaders Summit of COP26" in Scotland. As a developing tropical island nation with rich biodiversity, Sri Lanka is acutely aware of the climate impacts. The speech highlighted the urgent need for global action to combat climate change.

Title: Ambassador – designate of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia assumes duties
Summary: Ambassador-designate Pakeer Amza assumed duties at the Sri Lankan Embassy in Riyadh on October 31, 2021. The ceremony was organized by the embassy staff to mark the occasion.

Title: Speech by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa at the “Rediscovering Nitrogen: Solutions and Synergies for Climate Change, Health, Biodiversity and Circular Economy”, COP26 Side Event, Scotland, UK on 31 October 2021
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered a speech at the COP26 Side Event in Scotland on October 31, 2021, focusing on the importance of addressing climate change. He highlighted the significance of solutions and synergies related to nitrogen in combating climate change, promoting health, biodiversity, and circular economy. The President expressed pleasure in seeing a notable turnout at the event, emphasizing the urgency of tackling the global climate crisis.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof G. L. Peiris visits Jesus College, University of Cambridge for discussions
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris visited Jesus College, University of Cambridge, to discuss issues concerning Sri Lanka and its future. The discussion included participation from Professor Sir Ivan Lawrence QC.

Title: Speech delivered by Foreign Minister Professor G. L. Peiris when Foreign Minister Peiris and the British Prime Minister’s Special Envoy for Trade with Sri Lanka Lord Mervyn Davies of Abersoch jointly inaugurated the Sri Lanka – United Kingdom Chamber of Commerce at the Sri Lankan High Commission in London.
Summary: Foreign Minister Professor G. L. Peiris delivered a speech at the inauguration of the Sri Lanka – United Kingdom Chamber of Commerce in London, alongside British Prime Minister's Special Envoy for Trade with Sri Lanka Lord Mervyn Davies of Abersoch. The event took place at the Sri Lankan High Commission.

Title: Final Keynote Address Hon. Tharaka Balasuriya,  State Minister of Regional Cooperation at the  “Youth in Climate Action Virtual Conference”, 29 October 2021
Summary: Hon. Tharaka Balasuriya, State Minister of Regional Cooperation, delivered the final keynote address at the "Youth in Climate Action Virtual Conference" on October 29, 2021. Ms. Maryaam Rehman, Director of the British Council, introduced the Minister to the audience.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof G. L. Peiris meets the UK Foreign Secretary
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris met with UK Foreign Secretary Elizabeth Truss on October 26, 2021, at the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office in the UK. The meeting aimed to discuss bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Consular Services provided by the Foreign Ministry
Summary: The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry is currently experiencing a high demand for authentication of certificates and documents from across the country. The division efficiently provides these services to service seekers nationwide.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof G. L. Peiris calls on the Speaker of the House of Commons
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris met with the Speaker of the House of Commons, Sir Lindsay Hoyle, on October 26, 2021. During the meeting, Minister Prof. Peiris highlighted the historical significance of the Sri Lankan Parliament's establishment.

Title: Political Consultations between Sri Lanka and Kingdom Bahrain
Summary: Sri Lanka and Bahrain held their first virtual session of Political Consultations today (21 October 2021). The two countries signed an MOU on Political Consultations in 2009.

Title: US Ambassador pays farewell call on Foreign Minister
Summary: US Ambassador Alaina B. Teplitz paid a farewell visit to Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Professor G. L. Peiris at the Foreign Ministry. During the meeting, they discussed bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Representative of Sri Lanka to the State of Palestine Nawalage Bennet Cooray  presents Credentials to the President of the State of Palestine
Summary: Sri Lanka's Representative to the State of Palestine, Nawalage Bennet Cooray, presented his Letter of Credence to the President of the State of Palestine on October 14, 2021, at the Presidential Palace in Ramallah. This formalized his role as Sri Lanka's official envoy to Palestine.

Title: French Ambassador pays courtesy call on Foreign Minister Peiris
Summary: French Ambassador Eric Lavertu paid a courtesy call on Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris at the Foreign Ministry in Sri Lanka. Both sides expressed satisfaction with the multifaceted cooperation and friendship between the two countries.

Title: High Commissioner designate of Sri Lanka to Canada calls on the Chief of Protocol of Canada
Summary: High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to Canada, Harsha Kumara Navaratne, met with the Chief of Protocol of Canada, Stewart Wheeler, in Ottawa on 15 October 2021. This meeting took place following Navaratne's arrival in Canada on 14 October 2021.

Title: Czech Ambassador pays a farewell call on Foreign Minister Peiris
Summary: Czech Ambassador Milan Hovorka bid farewell to Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris during a visit to the Foreign Ministry on October 14, 2021. Minister Peiris warmly welcomed the ambassador before his departure.

Title: Malaysia and Sri Lanka to enhance cooperation in the fields of digitalization and education
Summary: Malaysia's High Commissioner to Colombo, Tan Yang Thai, visited Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on October 14, 2021, to discuss enhancing cooperation in digitalization and education. The meeting aimed to strengthen the close and friendly bilateral ties between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka and Algeria discuss enhancement of political and economic ties at first ever bilateral consultations
Summary: Sri Lanka and Algeria conducted their inaugural Foreign Ministry Level Virtual Bilateral Consultations on October 12, 2021, aiming to enhance political and economic ties. The discussions centered on strengthening cooperation in political and economic spheres. This meeting marks a significant step towards deepening relations between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka Participates in the 6th Ministerial Meeting of CICA
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage participated in the 6th Ministerial Meeting of CICA, delivering the country's statement virtually. The meeting focused on foreign affairs and confidence-building measures among member countries.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris addresses the Diplomatic Community at Foreign Ministry
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris addressed the Colombo-based diplomatic community at the Foreign Ministry auditorium on October 13, 2021. The meeting provided an opportunity for the Foreign Minister to engage with the diplomatic community.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Brazil Sumith Dassanayake presents Credentials to the President of Brazil
Summary: Ambassador Sumith Dassanayake of Sri Lanka presented his Letters of Credence to President Jair Bolsonaro at the Palácio Do Planalto in Brasilia, officially assuming his role as Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Brazil.

Title: Sri Lanka and Russia Reaffirm Strong Partnership at Bilateral Political Consultations in Moscow
Summary: Sri Lanka and Russia reaffirmed their strong partnership during the 10th Round of Bilateral Political Consultations held at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia in Moscow on Friday, October 8, 2021. The consultations aimed to strengthen diplomatic ties between the two countries.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris meets with Canadian High Commissioner David McKinnon
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris met with Canadian High Commissioner David McKinnon at the Foreign Ministry on 8 October. They discussed various areas of ongoing bilateral cooperation, and the Minister briefed the High Commissioner on relevant matters.

Title: Prof. Janitha A. Liyanage assumes duties as the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Russia
Summary: Prof. Janitha Abeywickrema Liyanage has officially started her role as the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Russia following a ceremony at the Embassy on October 4, 2021.

Title: Foreign Minister Peiris underscores the need to strengthen economic ties with Bangladesh
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris emphasized the significance of enhancing economic ties with Bangladesh, underscoring Sri Lanka's commitment to strengthening relations, particularly in economic cooperation. He made these remarks during a courtesy call.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris co- chairs meeting with Minister Namal Rajapaksa on upgrading the digitalization of Consular Services at the Foreign Ministry
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris co-chaired a meeting with Minister Namal Rajapaksa to discuss upgrading the digitalization of Consular Services at the Foreign Ministry. The meeting aimed to enhance the efficiency and accessibility of consular services through digital technology.

Title: Singaporeans donate COVID 19 related medical equipment to Sri Lanka
Summary: Singaporeans donated COVID-19 related medical equipment to Sri Lanka through the collaboration between the Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore and the Religious Advisor of the Maha Karuna Buddhist Society of Singapore, Ven. Dr. K. Gunaratana Thero.

Title: Sri Lanka community in Oman donates COVID 19 related medical equipment to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Sri Lankan community in Oman donated a consignment of medical equipment, including ICU beds, to treat COVID-19 patients in Sri Lanka. The donation was made by the Sri Lankan Quantity Surveyors Fraternity, bankers, and other professionals. This contribution aims to support the country's efforts in combating the pandemic.

Title: Korea donates a further consignment of COVID 19 related medical equipment to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Korea, via the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA), donated COVID-19 medical equipment worth USD 450,000 to Sri Lanka. The consignment includes PCR detection kits and 5 PCR machines for rapid testing, aiding Sri Lanka's pandemic response efforts.

Title: Providing Consular Services to Public by the Foreign Ministry

Summary: Foreign Minister Professor G.L Peiris reiterated support for the Palestine cause during a courtesy call by the Palestine Ambassador, Dr. Zuhair M.H. Dar Zaid, at the Foreign Ministry on September 28th. The meeting emphasized the ongoing commitment to the Palestinian cause.

Summary: New Zealand's High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Michael Appleton, visited Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris at the Foreign Ministry on September 29, 2021, to extend congratulations. The meeting was a courtesy call to discuss bilateral relations between the two countries.

Summary: Myanmar Ambassador to Sri Lanka U Han Thu met with Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris at the Foreign Ministry on 28 September 2021. During the meeting, Ambassador Thu congratulated Prof. Peiris on his recent appointment as the Foreign Minister.

Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Title: Sri Lanka, British Ministers discuss Trade, Investment, and Domestic Reconciliation Process
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris and British Minister of State for South Asia, Lord Ahmad of Wimbledon, recently discussed trade, investment, and the domestic reconciliation process at the Sri Lanka Mission in New York. Title: Statement by H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka at the High Level Dialogue on Energy
Summary: In a statement at the High Level Dialogue on Energy, Sri Lankan President H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa addressed key energy-related issues. The President's speech can be viewed at the provided link on YouTube.

Summary: H.E. the President delivered a statement at the Food Systems Summit in New York on September 23, 2021. The full statement can be viewed at the provided YouTube link.

Summary: South African Minister for International Relations and Cooperation Dr. Naledi Pandor met with Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris at the Permanent Mission of South Africa in New York on Friday, September 24, 2021. Summary: Foreign Minister of Indonesia Retno Lestari Priansari Marsudi welcomed the Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka to the Mission of Indonesia in New York. The Indonesian Foreign Minister emphasized the importance of bilateral relations between the two countries.

Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris requested UAE's assistance in oil purchases during a meeting with UAE's Minister of Industry and Advanced Technology Dr. Sultan Al Jaber at the 76th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

Summary: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris and Thailand's Deputy Prime Minister Don Pramudwinai discussed their strong bilateral ties as two countries practicing Theravada Buddhism, aiming to build on their shared Buddhist heritage.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris called on the Indian Foreign Minister Dr S. Jaishankar on the sidelines of the U. N. General Assembly in New York, USA on 22 September 2021
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G. L. Peiris met with Indian Foreign Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar at the U.N. General Assembly in New York on September 22, 2021. During the meeting, Prof. Peiris briefed Dr. Jaishankar on Sri Lanka's successful measures to control the spread of Covid-19.

Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered a speech at the 76th UN General Assembly in New York on September 22, 2021. The video of the speech can be viewed at https://youtu.be/0yttqpTMkvQ.

Title: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to India Milinda Moragoda presents Credentials to the President of India Shri Ram Nath Kovind
Summary: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to India, Milinda Moragoda, appointed with cabinet rank, presented his Letter of Credence to President Shri Ram Nath Kovind of India today in New Delhi. This formal act signifies the official start of his diplomatic duties in India.

Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris and OIC Secretary-General Yousef Al-Othaimeen emphasized the importance of integration among communities while preserving their identities. Both officials highlighted the positive outcomes of fostering unity and diversity within societies.

Summary: Sri Lankan Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage reaffirmed that Sri Lanka will maintain neutrality in the Indian Ocean and pose no threat to any country during his Special Address at the 'Ocean Nations: An In' event. Summary: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris met with Australian Foreign Minister Marise Payne in New York on the eve of the 76th Session of the United Nations General Assembly. Summary: Foreign Minister G.L. Peiris held a bilateral meeting with Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu at the Turkish House in New York on Friday, September 17, 2021. The meeting took place at the Chancery building of the Turkish Permanent Mission.

Summary: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris addressed the Ministerial Sessions on 'Foreign Policy and Religion' at the G20 Interfaith Forum in Bologna, Italy. Summary: At the 48th Regular Session of the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva on September 14, 2021, Hon. Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka, Prof. G.L. Summary: The Government of Sri Lanka expresses solidarity with the US Government on the 20th Anniversary of 9/11, commemorating the lives lost in the tragic terrorist attacks. Today marks two decades since the events that affected not only the USA but also many other nationalities.

Title: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris  calls for enhanced economic cooperation with Iran
Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris has called for enhanced economic cooperation with Iran, focusing on increased bilateral trade, investment, and potential collaboration in sectors like tourism and energy. Summary: Ambassador of Viet Nam in Colombo, Ho Thi Thanh Truc, visited Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris at the Foreign Ministry on September 8, 2021. The meeting likely discussed the 50th Anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Viet Nam and Sri Lanka.

Summary: The Prime Minister and Foreign Minister will visit Bologna, Italy to attend an international event alongside the Prime Minister of Italy and other dignitaries.

Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris met with Dutch Ambassador Tanja Gonggrijp at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo to discuss Sri Lanka's longstanding relations with the Netherlands. The meeting highlighted the strong diplomatic ties between the two countries.

Summary: The Ambassador of the Republic of Korea to Sri Lanka, Santhush Woonjin Jeong, met with the newly appointed Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on August 24, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry. During the meeting, they discussed priorities for enhancing Sri Lanka-Korea relations.

Summary: The Foreign Ministry, led by Foreign Minister Prof. G.L.Peiris, extends heartfelt condolences on the passing of former Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera. Samaraweera served with distinction in his role.

Summary: Ambassador of Pakistan to Sri Lanka, Major General Muhammad Saad Khattak, met with the new Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris on August 20, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry to offer congratulations.

Summary: Ambassador of Japan to Sri Lanka, Akira Sugiyama, congratulated the new Foreign Minister, Prof. G.L. Peiris, on his appointment and reaffirmed Japan's ongoing support and cooperation with Sri Lanka during their meeting.

Summary: The Russian Ambassador, Yuri B. Materiy, met with Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris to discuss their countries' broad cooperation. The meeting took place at the Foreign Ministry on Friday, highlighting the strong ties between Sri Lanka and Russia.

Summary: Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris, who recently took office, held discussions with EU Ambassador Denis Chaibi at the Foreign Ministry in Sri Lanka. The meeting focused on exploring wide-ranging cooperation between Sri Lanka and the European Union.

Summary: High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka, Gopal Baglay, met with the new Foreign Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris following his assumption of duties. Foreign Minister Peiris expressed appreciation for the support from India.

Summary: The Government of Sri Lanka is closely monitoring the situation in Afghanistan and expresses deep concern. Their primary focus is on ensuring the safety and security of Sri Lankans living in Afghanistan and facilitating evacuations.

Summary: During the nationwide lockdown from 20 August to 30 August 2021, the Foreign Ministry's Consular Affairs Division will provide limited services only to those with urgent needs. Regular services will resume after the lockdown period ends.

Summary: Sri Lanka, known for its global appeal as a leisure destination, is leading efforts to boost regional and domestic tourism through enhanced cooperation. Summary: Efforts are underway to evacuate Sri Lankan nationals from Afghanistan amidst the current situation. The Foreign Ministry is actively working on the evacuation process to ensure the safety of its citizens in Afghanistan.

Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena praised the late Lakshman Kadirgamar as a remarkable Minister and exemplary leader from Sri Lanka. Minister Gunawardena made these remarks while paying tribute to Kadirgamar.

Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena discussed bilateral priorities with Saudi Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Adel bin Ahmed Al-Jubeir in a virtual meeting. Gunawardena praised the strong bilateral relations with Saudi Arabia during the discussion.

Summary: At the 47th Consultative Committee Meeting of The Colombo Plan, Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka, delivered the inaugural address. Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena emphasized the importance of The Colombo Plan in facing post-pandemic global challenges during the 47th Consultative Committee Meeting. He highlighted the organization's work and experience in socio-economic development.

Summary: COP26 Regional Ambassador for Asia-Pacific and South Asia Ken O’Flaherty praised Sri Lanka for submitting its updated Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) with ambitious commitments on renewable energy and climate action. Summary: Ambassador of Japan to Sri Lanka, Akira Sujiama, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena to express gratitude for Sri Lanka's solidarity in participating in the Tokyo Olympics. Japan appreciates the support shown by Sri Lanka through its presence at this year's Olympic Games.

Title: State Minister of Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya stresses Sri Lanka’s commitment for enhanced cooperation at the 28th ASEAN Regional Forum (ARF)
Summary: State Minister of Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya highlighted Sri Lanka's dedication to increased cooperation at the 28th ASEAN Regional Forum (ARF) held virtually on August 6, 2021. He emphasized Sri Lanka's commitment to enhancing collaboration with the ARF members.

Summary: Foreign Minister Gunawardena emphasized the importance of enhanced global collaboration on vaccines at the First International Forum on COVID-19 Vaccine Cooperation held virtually on August 5, 2021. Summary: High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka, Gopal Baglay, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on August 3, 2021. Minister Gunawardena expressed gratitude to India for their assistance.
