Summary: State Minister of Regional Cooperation, Tharaka Balasuriya, engaged in virtual discussions with the Minister of Commerce, Industry, and Investment Promotion of Oman to strengthen bilateral economic ties in line with the ministry's focus on enhancing relations with the Middle East.

Title: New Ambassador of Viet Nam to Sri Lanka calls on the Foreign Minister
Summary: The newly appointed Ambassador of Viet Nam to Sri Lanka, Ho Thi Thanh Truc, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Foreign Ministry on July 15, 2021. The Foreign Minister welcomed Ambassador Truc to Sri Lanka during the meeting.

Title: Sri Lanka launches the Submarine Cable Protection and Resilience Framework
Summary: Sri Lanka launched the Submarine Cable Protection and Resilience Framework on July 15, 2021, making it the first country in Asia to do so. The framework was introduced at a stakeholder meeting chaired by Secretary to the President Dr. P. B. Jayasundara.

Title: Statement by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka International Conference “Central and South Asia: Regional Connectivity. Challenges and Opportunities”   Tashkent, Republic of Uzbekistan, 15-16 July 2021
Summary: Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka, Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, participated in the International Conference "Central and South Asia: Regional Connectivity. Challenges and Opportunities" in Tashkent, Uzbekistan on July 15-16, 2021. He expressed his honor to engage in discussions on the relevant topics at the high-level forum.

Title: US Ambassador calls on the Foreign Minister
Summary: The US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Alaina Teplitz, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on July 13. During the meeting, Minister Gunawardena expressed gratitude to the United States for their assistance. The discussion highlighted the strong diplomatic relations between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka and Australia to strengthen practical cooperation
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Australian High Commissioner David Holly on July 13, 2021, to explore ways to enhance practical cooperation between the two countries across various sectors. They discussed strategies to strengthen relations, aiming to achieve mutual benefits and progress.

Title: Viet Nam Sri Lanka Bilateral Relations to get a boost in Organic Farming, Investments in IT Sector and Tourism
Summary: The Ambassador of Viet Nam in Colombo, Ho Thi Thanh Truc, met with State Minister of Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya at the Foreign Ministry premises on July 13, 2021. The discussions focused on enhancing bilateral relations through initiatives in organic farming, investments in the IT sector, and promoting tourism between Viet Nam and Sri Lanka.

Title: Foreign Ministry takes steps to collect Buddhist information around the world
Summary: The Foreign Ministry is collecting and documenting information on Buddhist places of worship globally to expand Sri Lanka's relations with Buddhist countries. This initiative aims to enhance cultural ties and promote understanding among nations.

Title: Foreign Minister meets Foreign Consul Generals in Sri Lanka
Summary: The Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka met with Resident Consul Generals to seek their mediation in securing foreign aid for the country amid the COVID-19 pandemic. This request was made to address the impact of the epidemic on Sri Lanka.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Luxembourg Minister of Foreign Affairs Jean Asselborn review bilateral cooperation
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Luxembourg's Minister of Foreign Affairs Jean Asselborn have agreed to enhance bilateral cooperation by expanding into new mutually beneficial areas. The two ministers aim to strengthen their relations for mutual benefit.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Poland Dhammika Kumari Semasinghe presented Letters of Credence in Poland
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Poland, Dhammika Kumari Semasinghe, presented the Letters of Credence to President Andrzej Duda at the Belvedere Palace in Warsaw on July 6, 2021. The formal presentation solidifies her role as the official representative of Sri Lanka in Poland.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Slovenia Majintha Jayesinghe presented Letters of Credence in Slovenia
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Slovenia, Majintha Jayesinghe, presented the Letters of Credence to the President of the Republic of Slovenia, Borut Pahor, at the Presidential Palace in Ljubljana, accrediting as the Ambassador. This formal ceremony solidified Jayesinghe's official role as the Sri Lankan Ambassador to Slovenia.

Title: Foreign Ministry discusses the environmental and economic impact of the X-Express Pearl fire
Summary: The Foreign Ministry, led by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunewardena, held a special discussion on July 1 to address the environmental and economic impact of the X-Press Pearl fire. The meeting focused on assessing the repercussions of the incident.

Title: Communication on the impact on the working public by suspending the GSP+ facility by Trade Unions to the Foreign Minister
Summary: Trade unions have requested the Foreign Minister to address the impact on the working public if Sri Lanka loses the GSP+ facility due to resolutions passed in the European Union Parliament. Five major trade unions are concerned about how this suspension would affect the country's workforce.

Title: Assistance is sought from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) to conduct a survey on the composition of Sri Lankan soil and grant a soil card to farmers
Summary: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) is assisting Sri Lanka in conducting a survey on the composition of its soil and issuing soil cards to farmers. This initiative aims to streamline the use of organic fertilizer in the country, as highlighted by the FAO.

Title: New UNICEF Country Representative presents his Credentials to Foreign Minister
Summary: The new UNICEF Country Representative to Sri Lanka, Christian Skoog, presented his credentials to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on July 5, 2022.

Title: Foreign Secretary Colombage interviewed on ‘Ada Derana Get Real by Mahieash Johnney’
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage was interviewed by Mahieash Johnney on Ada Derana Get Real. The discussion focused on India's concerns regarding the Port City project. The interview took place on Episode 110 on July 5, 2021.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena virtually interacts with Sri Lankan expats in Singapore and Brunei Darussalam
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena virtually engaged with Sri Lankan expats in Singapore and Brunei Darussalam, including community and business associations, the Maha Sangha, and religious leaders. The interaction was productive and aimed at fostering connections with overseas Sri Lankans.

Title: Sri Lanka informs EU of action to review PTA and on progress in reconciliation
Summary: Sri Lanka has informed the European Union about its actions to review the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) and the progress made in reconciliation efforts. The update was provided by the Government of Sri Lanka during its routine engagement and dialogue with the EU through the Foreign Ministry.

Title: New FAO Country Representative calls on the Foreign Minister
Summary: The newly appointed Country Representative of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) to Sri Lanka, Vimlendra Sharan, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Foreign Ministry on June 28, 2021. The meeting aimed to strengthen cooperation between FAO and Sri Lanka in the field of food and agriculture.

Title: Foreign Minister meets the new WHO Representative to Sri Lanka
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena welcomed Dr. Alaka Singh, the new WHO Representative to Sri Lanka, during a meeting at the Ministry today (25 June). The meeting aimed to strengthen collaboration between Sri Lanka and the WHO.

Title: Statement by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena, at the NIICE Global Conclave 2021,  25 June, 2021
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed gratitude to the Nepal Institute for International Cooperation and Engagement (NIICE) for inviting him to address the Inaugural Session at the NIICE Global Conclave 2021 on June 25, 2021.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena attends the Asia-Pacific High Level Conference on Belt and Road Cooperation
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena participated in the Asia-Pacific High Level Conference on Belt and Road Cooperation on June 23, 2021, emphasizing the need for increased cooperation among states and other participants. The conference was held virtually.

Title: India and Sri Lanka agree to co-operate on common issues in the region
Summary: India and Sri Lanka have agreed to cooperate on common regional issues. During a telephone conversation, Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Indian External Affairs Minister discussed steps taken to enhance bilateral relations. The two countries aim to strengthen their ties for mutual benefit.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kazakhstan Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents credentials to Kazakhstan President
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kazakhstan Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presented his Letters of Credence to Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev at a ceremony held at Acorda Presidentia. The event marked the official recognition of Lamawansa as Sri Lanka's representative to Kazakhstan.

Title: Procument Notice – Ministry of Agriculture Sri Lanka
Summary: The Ministry of Agriculture in Sri Lanka has issued a procurement notice for the importation of organic fertilizer and natural minerals (Potassium Chloride) for paddy cultivation. This pre-qualification document is under the State Ministry of Production, Supply, and Regulation of Organic and Natural Fertilizer. Interested parties should take note of this opportunity for agricultural support.

Title: The General Administration Customs of China (GACC) approves the Health Certificate for importing fisheries products to China
Summary: The General Administration of Customs of China (GACC) has approved the Health Certificate for importing fisheries products to China. This approval allows the entry of approved fisheries and aquatic products into the lucrative Chinese market.

Title: State Ministry of Regional Cooperation facilitates collaboration on Graphene applications with Russian Company
Summary: The State Ministry of Regional Cooperation is facilitating collaboration on Graphene applications with a Russian company to harness Sri Lanka's natural resources for economic growth. This initiative aims to explore sustainable ways for the country's development.

Title: Foreign Ministry hosts stakeholder meeting to brief foreign experts  on the MV-X Press Pearl Disaster
Summary: The European Union (EU)/ECHO, through the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), supports three technical experts to assist the Sri Lankan Government in assessing the impact of the MV-X Press Pearl Disaster. The experts were briefed during a stakeholder meeting hosted by the Foreign Ministry.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and U.K. Minister for South Asia, Lord Ahmad discuss steps to enhance bilateral cooperation
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and UK Minister for South Asia, Lord Tariq Ahmad discussed enhancing bilateral cooperation during a video call on Thursday, June 17. Both ministers agreed to explore opportunities to strengthen ties between their countries.

Title: The Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka assures that the prospect to leave for work in Korea will be provided shortly
Summary: The Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Woonjin Jeong, assured the Foreign Minister that necessary facilities for eligible Sri Lankan youth to work in Korea will be provided soon. This initiative aims to facilitate their travel and employment opportunities in Korea.

Title: Compensation, salary dues and other redress to the family members of  deceased Sri Lankan migrant workers overseas
Summary: The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry held a ceremony at the Ministry Premises to provide compensation, salary dues, and other redress to the families of deceased Sri Lankan migrant workers abroad. Letters of compensation were handed over to the respective family members during the event.

Title: Sri Lanka’s Observations on the Resolution adopted in the EU Parliament
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Ministry expressed regret over the resolution adopted in the European Parliament on June 10, 2021, titled "The Situation in Sri Lanka." The resolution addressed concerns about arrests made under the Prevention of Terrorism Act.

Title: State Minister Balasuriya calls for Indian Investors to join Sri Lanka in pursuit of ‘Shared Prosperity’
Summary: State Minister for Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya has called on Indian investors to join Sri Lanka in pursuing 'shared prosperity' by investing in the country. The minister emphasized the opportunity for both nations to benefit from this partnership.

Title: Foreign Minister Gunawardena conveys appreciation to Australian counterpart for support to Sri Lanka
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed appreciation to Australian counterpart Marise Payne for their support to Sri Lanka in a recent telephone conversation on Wednesday.

Title: Sri Lanka and Ethiopia discuss enhancement of political and economic ties at first ever bilateral consultations
Summary: Sri Lanka and Ethiopia engaged in their first-ever bilateral consultations at the Foreign Ministry level on June 9, 2021. The discussions focused on enhancing political and economic ties between the two countries. Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunaratne represented Sri Lanka during the virtual meeting.

Title: Foreign Minister Gunawardena appreciates Russia’s support to Sri Lanka in conversation with Foreign Minister Lavrov
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed deep appreciation to Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov for Russia's support to Sri Lanka during a telephone conversation on June 7, 2021. Gunawardena highlighted the importance of the support extended by Russia.

Title: Congratulatory Message extended by Foreign Minister Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena to Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Maldives Hon. Abdulla Shahid
Summary: Foreign Minister Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena extended a congratulatory message to Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Maldives Hon. Abdulla Shahid. The message conveyed warm wishes and a commitment to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: US Chargé d’ Affaires calls on the Foreign Minister
Summary: US Chargé d’Affaires a.i. Martin T. Kelly visited Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo on June 8, 2021. During the meeting, the Foreign Minister expressed gratitude to the government and people of the US.

Title: BIMSTEC Day message of Hon Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena
Summary: Honorable Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena delivered a message on BIMSTEC Day. The message was conveyed in multiple languages, including English, Sinhala, and Tamil, emphasizing the importance of regional cooperation.

Title: Sri Lanka calls on US House Foreign Affairs Committee not to proceed with resolution on Sri Lanka
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador in Washington, Ravinatha Aryasinha, has formally requested the US House Foreign Affairs Committee not to proceed with Resolution H. RES. 413 on Sri Lanka, introduced by Congresswoman Deborah Ross. Sri Lanka urges the committee to reconsider the resolution.

Title: Sri Lanka Deputy High Commissioner-designate to Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Chennai-India assumed duties
Summary: Dr. Doraisamy Venkateshwaran has officially assumed duties as the Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Chennai, India on April 12, 2021. He will be representing the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka in South India.

Title: Statement on the Resolution introduced by the US House of Representatives
Summary: The Foreign Ministry acknowledges Resolution No. H.RES.413 introduced in the US House of Representatives by Representative Deborah K. Ross on May 18, 2021, along with four other Representatives.

Title: Virtual meeting between Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Minister of State of United Arab Emirates Ahamed Ali Al Sayegh
Summary: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and UAE Minister of State Ahamed Ali Al Sayegh held a virtual meeting on May 31, 2021. The discussion likely focused on bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Permanent Missions of Sri Lanka and Thailand to the United Nations co-host a virtual commemoration for International Day of Vesak
Summary: The Permanent Missions of Sri Lanka and Thailand co-hosted a virtual commemoration for the International Day of Vesak at the United Nations on May 25, 2021. This event celebrated the occasion with various activities and discussions.

Title: Message of Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the commemoration of the International Day of Vesak
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena delivered a message at the virtual commemoration of the International Day of Vesak hosted by the United Nations in Sri Lanka on May 26, 2021. The event was also attended by the Foreign Ministry and other Member States in Colombo.

Title: The message of Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka for Vesak Day 2021
Summary: Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka, Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, delivered a message for Vesak Day 2021. The message emphasized the significance of Vesak and its teachings for peace and harmony. Gunawardena highlighted the importance of compassion and understanding in fostering unity among all communities.

Title: The message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa President of Sri Lanka for Vesak Day 2021
Summary: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered messages in English, Sinhala, and Tamil for Vesak Day 2021. The messages were shared to commemorate the occasion and convey his wishes to the people.

Title: The video message (English) of Hon.Mahinda Rajapaksa Prime Minister of Sri Lanka for Vesak Day 2021
Summary: Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, has released a video message in English for Vesak Day 2021. The video can be downloaded from the following link: https://wetransfer.com/downloads/0b25d673fdd1e9f7551990bfd76e93.

Title: Foreign Ministry organizes several special Vesak programmes
Summary: The Foreign Ministry, led by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage, has organized special religious programmes to mark the Vesak Festival this year. The initiatives aim to celebrate Vesak and promote cultural understanding.

Title: Open Competitive Examination for Recruitment to Grade III of the Sri Lanka Foreign Service – 2020 (2021)
Summary: The Foreign Ministry announced amendments to the Gazette notification for the Open Competitive Examination for Grade III of the Sri Lanka Foreign Service – 2020 (2021). The Public Service Commission has approved changes to the advertising section. Interested candidates should review the updated requirements for the examination.

Title: Suspension of all inbound passenger arrival to Sri Lanka
Summary: Sri Lanka will suspend all inbound passenger arrivals.

Title: The last batch of detained Sri Lankan migrant workers in Saudi Arabia returns to Sri Lanka
Summary: The repatriation of Sri Lankan migrant workers detained in Riyadh and Jeddah has concluded, with the last batch of 103 detainees returning to Sri Lanka on Saudi Airlines SV 786 on 19 May.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets EU Ambassadors in Colombo
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with EU Ambassadors in Colombo on Tuesday, May 18, 2021. They discussed mutual interests, including EU-Sri Lanka cooperation, at the Foreign Ministry.

Title: State Ministry of Regional Cooperation launches Creative Economy Programme
Summary: The State Ministry of Regional Cooperation has launched the Creative Economy Programme to boost the country's economy and showcase Sri Lanka's cultural heritage. The initiative aims to promote the creative economy sector and support local artists and entrepreneurs.

Title: Sri Lanka concerned over escalating violence between Palestine and Israel
Summary: Sri Lanka is deeply concerned about the increasing violence between Palestine and Israel. The Foreign Minister recently expressed this concern to the Ambassador of Palestine in Sri Lanka, emphasizing the seriousness of the situation.

Title: The message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka on the occasion of Ramazan
Summary: President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, has conveyed his message on the occasion of Ramazan in English, Sinhala, and Tamil versions. The message aims to reach a diverse audience and promote unity during this important religious period.

Title: Sri Lanka Consulate General Office in Milan moves to new premises
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Milan, Italy is relocating to new premises at Via Giovanni da Udine, n. 15, 20156, Milan on May 18, 2021. This move aims to offer improved facilities for the Sri Lankan community in the area.

Title: Sri Lanka opposes Bill 104 of Ontario Legislative Assembly
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed deep concerns to Canadian High Commissioner David McKinnon about Ontario Legislative Assembly's Bill 104. The Sri Lankan government opposes the passing of this Private Member's Bill.

Title: Foreign Ministry hosts webinar to review measures of Port State Control and Maritime Safety and Security in the Indian Ocean Region
Summary: The Foreign Ministry hosted a webinar to review Port State Control measures and Maritime Safety and Security in the Indian Ocean Region. The event featured international legal experts, including Prof. Rüdiger Wolfrum and the Director of the Norwegian Centre for the Law of the Sea. The webinar aimed to enhance cooperation and compliance in maritime regulations for the region.

Title: High Commissioner Kananathan presents Credentials in Uganda
Summary: High Commissioner Veluppillai Kananathan presented his Letter of Credence appointing him as the High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Uganda, with residence in Kenya, to President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni.

Title: Statement on Saudi Arabia’s Saudi Green and Middle East Green Initiatives
Summary: Sri Lanka congratulates Saudi Arabia on its Saudi Green and Middle East Green Initiatives, aimed at fostering regional cooperation to address environmental challenges in Saudi Arabia and the broader region.

Title: Sri Lanka condemns the terrorist attack on Speaker of the Maldivian Parliament and former President of Maldives Hon. Mohamed Nasheed
Summary: Sri Lanka has condemned the terrorist attack on Hon. Mohamed Nasheed, the Speaker of the Maldivian Parliament and former President of Maldives, on May 6, 2021. The government and people stand united against such acts of violence.

Title: The Sixteenth Informal Meeting of the SAARC Finance Ministers
Summary: The Sixteenth Informal Meeting of the SAARC Finance Ministers took place virtually on May 5, 2021, from 1:30 PM to 3:30 PM (Manila Time). The meeting was held alongside the 54th Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank (ADB).

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka presents credentials to the Netherlands based Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
Summary: Ambassador Aruni Ranaraja of Sri Lanka presented her credentials to Dr. Fernando Arias, the Director General of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) in the Netherlands. She is now the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the OPCW, strengthening diplomatic ties between the two countries.

Title: The UK and Sri Lanka lead on ‘Nitrogen for Climate and Green Recovery’  27 – 29 April 2021, Colombo
Summary: The UK and Sri Lanka co-hosted a virtual event titled "Nitrogen for Climate and Green Recovery" from April 27 to 29, 2021, in Colombo. The event was organized by the British High Commission in Colombo and the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, focusing on environmental initiatives.

Title: Limited Services provided by the Consular Affairs Division
Summary: The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry has adjusted its operating hours to 7.30 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. in compliance with recent health authority guidelines amid the ongoing COVID-19 situation. Please note the limited services available during this time.

Title: Country Director of the World Food Programme (WFP) to Sri Lanka Abdur Rahim Siddiqui presents his credentials to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena
Summary: Abdur Rahim Siddiqui, the Country Director of the World Food Programme (WFP) in Sri Lanka, presented his credentials to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on May 3, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry. The Foreign Minister accepted the credentials during the official ceremony.

Title: Sri Lanka strongly condemns the terror attack on civilians in Pul-e-Alam city in Afghanistan
Summary: Sri Lanka has strongly condemned the terror attack on civilians that occurred on April 30, 2021, in Pul-e-Alam city, Logar Province, Afghanistan. The attack targeted civilians, including students and children, in an act of indiscriminate violence.

Title: The Message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka, on May Day
Summary: President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, delivered a May Day message available in English, Sinhala, and Tamil versions.

Title: Statement of His Excellency Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka  read by Honourable Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister
Summary: His Excellency Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka's statement for the Pre-COP26 virtual event on Nitrogen for Climate and Green Recovery was read by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena in Colombo on 27-29 April 2021. In his address, President Rajapaksa expressed great pleasure in speaking to the distinguished participants about the importance of the event.

Title: The first group of Sri Lankans held at the ‘Tarheel’ deportation camp in Riyadh to return to Sri Lanka tomorrow
Summary: The first group of Sri Lankans held at the 'Tarheel' deportation camp in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, will return to Sri Lanka on Friday (30). Subsequent groups will also be returning to Sri Lanka in the following days.

Title: Limited Services provided by the Consular Affairs Division
Summary: The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry is currently offering limited services to prioritize the health and safety of visitors amid the ongoing COVID-19 situation and recent health guidelines. Please be advised of the reduced service availability during this time.

Title: Sri Lanka participates in a region-wide activity to consolidate joint COVID-19 cooperation
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena joined a video conference today with counterparts from China, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Pakistan to discuss joint COVID-19 cooperation. The meeting aimed to strengthen collaboration in response to the pandemic.

Title: Sri Lanka Ambassador to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, presents Letters of Credence to Majesty the King of the Netherlands
Summary: Sri Lanka's new Ambassador to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, Aruni Ranaraja, presented her credentials to King Willem-Alexander at the Royal Palace in The Hague on April 21, 2021. The ceremony marked the official start of her diplomatic mission in the Netherlands.

Title: High Commissioner Srimal Wickremasinghe presents Credentials to the President of the Seychelles
Summary: High Commissioner Srimal Wickremasinghe presented his Letters of Credence to the President of the Republic of Seychelles on April 20, 2021, at a ceremony held at the State House. The event was attended by the Minister o.

Title: Speech by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at Stakeholder Dialogue on Climate Change, Resilience & Just Recovery in the Sectors of Agriculture, Forestry & Biodiversity
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed gratitude to SLYCAN Trust and stakeholders for the invitation to speak at the Stakeholder Dialogue on Climate Change, Resilience & Just Recovery in Agriculture, Forestry & Biodiversity. The event aimed to address crucial issues in these sectors for a sustainable future.

Title: Sri Lankan fishermen arrested in Myanmar will return to Sri Lanka tomorrow
Summary: The 12 Sri Lankan fishermen arrested in Myanmar will return to Sri Lanka tomorrow after the Foreign Ministry facilitated their repatriation. The fishermen were released following several rounds of talks with the Myanmar government.

Title: Presentation of Credentials to the Director General of UNESCO by the Ambassador Prof.  Kshanika Hirimburegama
Summary: Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented her credentials to UNESCO Director General Audrey Azoulay at a ceremony in Paris on April 16, 2021. She assumed the role as Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative.

Title: Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented Credentials to President of France Emmanuel Macron
Summary: Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented her credentials to President Emmanuel Macron on April 12, 2021, at the Elysee Palace in Paris. During the ceremony, President Macron encouraged all the Ambassadors.

Title: High Commissioner S. Amarasekara presents Credentials to President of South Africa Cyril Ramaphosa
Summary: High Commissioner S. Amarasekara presented his Letters of Credence to President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa on April 14, 2021, at the Sefako M Makgatho Presidential Guest House in Pretoria.

Title: Virtual Address by H.E. the President of Sri Lanka at the BOAO Forum for Asia 2021
Summary: President of Sri Lanka delivered a virtual address at the BOAO Forum for Asia 2021. The speech took place on April 20, 2021, addressing key issues at the forum.

Title: Dr. Palitha Kohona presents Credentials to the Chinese President
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona presented his Letters of Credence to Chinese President Xi Jinping on April 14, 2021, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. This formal exchange signifies the official start of his diplomatic role representing his country in China.

Title: Sinhala and Tamil New Year message of  President Gotabaya Rajapaksa
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has conveyed his Sinhala and Tamil New Year message to the nation, emphasizing unity and prosperity. The message was delivered in both Sinhala and Tamil languages to reach a wider audience and promote cultural harmony.

Title: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage’s Interview on “CGTN Dialogue” – 12 April 2021
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed Sri Lanka's COVID-19 situation, post-pandemic economic revival, and vaccination program during an interview on "CGTN Dialogue" on 12 April 2021.

Title: Special Representative of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa visits Oman
Summary: Special Representative of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, State Minister of Finance Ajith Nivard Cabraal, visited Oman from April 7 to 10, 2021.

Title: Foreign Minister signs the Book of Condolence
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena signed the Book of Condolence for the passing of His Royal Highness the Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh on behalf of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and the Government.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena discusses EU-Sri Lanka cooperation with EU Ambassadors in Colombo
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with EU Ambassadors in Colombo on Friday to discuss cooperation between the EU and Sri Lanka. The meeting took place at the Foreign Ministry, where Gunawardena briefed them on political and economic developments.

Title: Gazette notification to recruit 40 eligible candidates to join the Sri Lanka Foreign Service (SLFS)
Summary: The Foreign Ministry has announced a gazette notification for the recruitment of 40 eligible candidates to join the Sri Lanka Foreign Service (SLFS). The Gazette Notification No. 2,223 dated 9 is now published, inviting qualified individuals to apply for the positions. Interested candidates can find in the official notification.

Title: Sri Lanka and New Zealand inaugurate Foreign Ministry Consultations
Summary: Sri Lanka and New Zealand inaugurated their First Round of Foreign Ministry Consultations virtually on 08 April 2021. The meeting was co-chaired by the Acting Director General of the East Asia Division of the Foreign Ministry. This initiative aims to strengthen diplomatic ties between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka and Afghanistan sign MoU on Establishment of a Political Consultations Mechanism between Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Afghanistan
Summary: Sri Lanka and Afghanistan signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) today to establish a Political Consultations Mechanism between their respective Foreign Ministries. This agreement aims to enhance diplomatic cooperation and communication between the two countries.

Title: Entry Requirement for Sri Lankans Lifted
Summary: Sri Lankan entry requirements have been lifted following a review by the Foreign Ministry under President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's directive on April 6, 2021. This change aims to provide relief for prospective Lankan returnees, making it easier for them to enter the country.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman repatriates another group of 248 stranded Sri Lankan Migrant Workers back home
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, in collaboration with the President's Secretariat and the Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka, facilitated the repatriation of 248 stranded Sri Lankan migrant workers from Muscat. The special arrangements ensured their safe return home.

Title: The 5th Evacuation Flight from Lebanon 31 March 2021
Summary: On March 31, 2021, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon, in partnership with the Presidential Secretariat, Foreign Ministry, and Sri Lankan Airlines, successfully repatriated 175 Sri Lankans, including 4 children, on the 5th evacuation flight from Lebanon.

Title: Easter Sunday Message of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered an Easter Sunday message in English. The message aimed to convey his wishes for a peaceful and prosperous future for all citizens.

Title: The Chinese and Russian Ambassadors call on the Foreign Minister
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with the Russian Ambassador Yuri Meteriy and Chinese Ambassador Qi Zhenhong at the Foreign Ministry last Wednesday. The ambassadors discussed matters of mutual interest and cooperation with the Sri Lankan government.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena elected to chair the 17th Session of the Ministerial Meeting of BIMSTEC
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena has been elected to chair the 17th Session of the Ministerial Meeting of BIMSTEC, the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation. Gunawardena will lead the discussions at the upcoming meeting as the appointed chair.

Title: State Minister of Regional Cooperation meets Chinese Ambassador at Foreign Ministry
Summary: State Minister of Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya met with the Chinese Ambassador HE Qi Zhenhong at the Foreign Ministry on April 1, 2021. The meeting was a courtesy call to discuss cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Foreign Minister calls for early conclusion of Charter of the Association of BIMSTEC Speakers and Parliamentarians at the 17th BIMSTEC Ministerial Meeting
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena urged for the prompt finalization of the Charter of the Association of BIMSTEC Speakers and Parliamentarians during his welcome speech at the 17th BIMSTEC Ministerial Meeting.

Title: Appointment of the Ambassador of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Ho Thi Thanh Truc as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mrs. Truc will represent Viet Nam in her new diplomatic role in Sri Lanka.

Title: Interview of the Foreign Secretary on Hydepark of Ada Derana – 27 March 2021
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed the recent UNHRC draft resolution on Sri Lanka and the country's future direction in an interview on Hydepark of Ada Derana on March 27, 2021. The interview provided insights into Sri Lanka's response to the resolution and its strategic plans moving forward.

Title: Sri Lanka’s Envoy to the Kingdom of Sweden presents credentials
Summary: Ambassador Dharshana M. Perera has presented his credentials as Sri Lanka’s Envoy to the Kingdom of Sweden to His Majesty King Carl XVI Gustaf through a special arrangement with the Protocol Department.

Title: Leading the IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group, Sri Lanka finalizes the second Work Plan for 2022 to 2026
Summary: Sri Lanka, leading the IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group, finalized the second Work Plan for 2022 to 2026 during the 2nd Meeting of the IORA Working Group on Maritime Safety and Security held virtually on March 18-19, 2021. Delegates representing the Indian Ocean region participated in the meeting.

Title: Foreign Minister Gunawardena appreciates support of countries at UNHRC
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena briefed the media today on the outcome of the UNHRC sessions in Geneva, expressing appreciation for the support received from various countries. The media conference held at the Foreign Ministry highlighted the importance of international backing in addressing key issues.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets CDA of Romania to review bilateral cooperation
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Romania's Chargé d’Affaires, Ambassador Victor Chiujdea, to review bilateral cooperation at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo on Friday, 19 March. The discussions focused on enhancing collaboration between the two countries.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets Afghanistan Ambassador to discuss bilateral issues
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Afghanistan Ambassador Ashraf Haidari in Sri Lanka on March 19, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry to discuss bilateral issues. During the meeting, Ambassador Haidari provided a briefing on key matters of mutual interest.

Title: Foreign Secretary’s Interview on CNN-News18, India – 18 March 2021
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage was interviewed on CNN-News18, India on 18 March 2021. The interview can be viewed at the following links: https://t.co/U2puy4BA2D. He discussed important topics during the interview.

Title: Joint Communique  On the State Visit of H. E. Mahinda Rajapaksa, Prime Minister of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka to the People’s Republic of Bangladesh on 19 – 20 March 2021
Summary: During the State Visit on 19-20 March 2021, H. E. Mahinda Rajapaksa, Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, visited Bangladesh at the invitation of H. E. Sheikh Hasina, Prime Minister.

Title: The UK High Court quashes the judgement of the Westminster Magistrates’ Court against former Minister Counsellor (Defence) of the Sri Lanka High Commission in London Major Gen Priyanka Fernando
Summary: The UK High Court has overturned the judgement of the Westminster Magistrates’ Court against Major Gen Priyanka Fernando, the former Minister Counsellor (Defence) of the Sri Lanka High Commission in London. The appeal made by Major Gen Priyanka Fernando was successful, resulting in the quashing of the previous ruling.

Title: Allegations made against us at the Geneva Human Rights Council are politically biased  – Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena has stated that the allegations of human rights abuses in Sri Lanka at the Geneva Human Rights Council are politically biased, with countries like the UK, Canada, and Germany using them for political motives. Gunawardena believes these actions are aimed at concealing the truth.

Title: Opening Remarks by Admiral Professor Jayanath Colombage, Foreign Secretary, on the occasion of the  Second Meeting of the IORA Working Group on Maritime Safety and Security Colombo, Sri Lanka,  18th March 2021
Summary: Admiral Professor Jayanath Colombage, Foreign Secretary, delivered opening remarks at the Second Meeting of the IORA Working Group on Maritime Safety and Security in Colombo, Sri Lanka on March 18, 2021. Attendees included Hannah Singer, the U.N. Resident Coordinator in Colombo, and Dr. Gatot H. Gunawan, Acting Secretary General of IORA, along with members of the Diplomatic Corps.

Title: Handing over the cheque of Compensation to the Next of Kin of late Mr. K P Manjula Antony
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena presented a compensation cheque of SLRs. 2,653,125.00 to the spouse of late Mr. K P Manjula Antony on March 16, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry premises. The compensation was handed over as a gesture of support to the next of kin.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets with Pakistan High Commissioner in Colombo
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Pakistan High Commissioner Major General (Retd.) Muhammad Saad Khattak on March 16, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo. The meeting aimed to enhance bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: Media Statement of the Foreign Ministry-16 March 2021
Summary: The Foreign Ministry addressed recent media reports on a proposed ban on burqa and niqab in Sri Lanka. Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage clarified that no decision has been made regarding the ban.

Title: The present government is committed to developing the country as an independent, sovereign, free and unitary state – Minister Dinesh Gunawardena
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena affirmed the government's dedication to developing the country as an independent, sovereign, free, and unitary state. He emphasized this commitment during a recent speech, highlighting the importance of preserving these fundamental principles for the nation's progress.

Title: Media Statement-The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing , 13 March 2021
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing discovered the misuse of the Sri Lankan flag image on a "Non-Slip Doormat" made in China. Upon receiving this information, the Embassy promptly notified the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The Embassy took immediate action to address the issue.

Title: Ambassadors’ Forum of Sri Lanka launches the book Geneva Crisis – The Way Forward
Summary: The Ambassadors’ Forum of Sri Lanka launched the book "Geneva Crisis – The Way Forward" today at the Foreign Ministry. The launch event was attended by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Foreign Secretary Admiral Professor.

Title: Media Statement of the Foreign Ministry-12 March 2021
Summary: The Foreign Ministry issued a statement addressing reports of a "Sri Lanka Flag Non-Slip Doormat" being sold on Amazon. Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage commented on the matter, emphasizing the need for respect towards national symbols.

Title: Ambassador Prof. M. D. Lamawansa presents Credentials to the President of Armenia
Summary: Ambassador Prof. M. D. Lamawansa commenced his duties by presenting his Letter of Credence to President Armen Sarkissian of Armenia on February 23, 2021. This marks the official beginning of his role as Ambassador Extraordina.

Title: Security Council Arria-Formula Meeting  “Call to Lead by Example: Ensuring the Full, Equal and Meaningful Participation of Women in UN-led Peace Processes”
Summary: The Security Council held an Arria-Formula Meeting on "Ensuring the Full Participation of Women in UN-led Peace Processes." H.E. Mohan Peiris, Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka, thanked and congratulated the co-chairs Mexico and Ireland for their leadership in the meeting. The event aimed to promote women's meaningful involvement in peace processes.

Title: Regional Consular Office of the Foreign Ministry will open in Trincomalee
Summary: The Regional Consular Office of the Foreign Ministry will be inaugurated in Trincomalee on Saturday, 13 March 2021, at 2:00 pm. Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage will lead the ceremonial launch.

Title: The Message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka on the occasion of Maha Shivarathri Celebration
Summary: President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, delivered a message on the occasion of Maha Shivarathri Celebration. The message was available in English, Sinhala, and Tamil languages, emphasizing cultural inclusivity and unity among communities.

Title: Media Statement of the Foreign Ministry – 10 March 2021
Summary: The Foreign Ministry issued a statement addressing reports about an invitation extended to the Foreign Minister of Myanmar to attend the 17th BIMSTEC Ministerial Meeting on April 1, 2021, hosted virtually in Colombo.

Title: Ambassador – designate to Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne presents open copy of the Letter of Credence
Summary: Ambassador-designate to Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne met with Director General Chittipat Tongprasroeth of the Department of Protocol at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on March 3, 2021. During the meeting, he presented an open copy of his Letter of Credence.

Title: Consultations on the Seventh Biennial Review of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy
Summary: Consultations on the Seventh Biennial Review of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy were held at the General Assembly Hall, UNHQ on Friday, 05 March 2021. H.E. Mohan Peiris, the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations, delivered a statement during the in-person meeting.

Title: Foreign Secretary Colombage interviewed on ‘Talk to Al Jazeera’
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage was interviewed on 'Talk to Al Jazeera' on March 6, 2021. The interview is available for viewing at https://www.aljazeera.com/program/ta.

Title: Ambassadors of Bangladesh, Brazil, Korea and Japan meet Foreign Minister
Summary: Ambassadors from Bangladesh, Brazil, Korea, and Japan met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena individually at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo on the 3rd. The meetings aimed to discuss bilateral relations and cooperation between the respective countries.

Title: Newly appointed Sri Lanka Ambassador to the Kingdom of Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne assumes duties
Summary: C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne, the newly appointed Sri Lanka Ambassador to the Kingdom of Thailand, began his duties on March 1, 2021, at the Sri Lanka Embassy in Bangkok. The Embassy is concurrently accredited to other countries in the region.

Title: Statement by Hon. Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka  Agenda Item 2: Interactive Dialogue on the OHCHR Report ‘Promoting reconciliation, accountability and human rights in Sri Lanka’ (A/HRC/46/20)  24th February 2021
Summary: During the interactive dialogue on the OHCHR Report 'Promoting reconciliation, accountability, and human rights in Sri Lanka,' the Hon. Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka addressed the Resolution 30/1 and 40/1. The report presented today is a result of these resolutions, as acknowledged by the Government of Sri Lanka.

Title: Pakistan Minister of Foreign Affairs Makhdoom Shah Mehmood Qureshi calls on Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Foreign Ministry
Summary: Pakistan's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Makhdoom Shah Mehmood Qureshi, visited the Foreign Ministry today, 24 February 2021, where he met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena. The meeting aimed to discuss bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.

Title: Joint Communiqué on the visit of H.E. Imran Khan, Prime Minister of Pakistan to Sri Lanka on 23-24 February 2021
Summary: Prime Minister Imran Khan of Pakistan visited Sri Lanka on 23-24 February 2021 at the invitation of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa. The two leaders engaged in discussions during the two-day official visit.

Title: Statement by Hon Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka  High Level Segment of the  46th Session of the UN Human Rights Council  23 February 2021, Geneva
Summary: During the High Level Segment of the 46th Session of the UN Human Rights Council on February 23, 2021, the Hon Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka addressed the audience, acknowledging the report published by the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR). The statement highlighted the country's commitment to addressing human rights concerns.

Title: 2021 ECOSOC Special Meeting  Reimagining Equality: Eliminating racism, xenophobia and discrimination  for all in the decade of action for the SDGs
Summary: At the 2021 ECOSOC Special Meeting, H.E. Mohan Peiris, the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations, addressed the theme "Reimagining Equality: Eliminating racism, xenophobia, and discrimination for all in the decade of action for the SDGs" on Thursday, 18 February 2021, during a virtual session. Peiris highlighted the historical challenges posed by racism, xenophobia, and discrimination.

Title: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan to visit Sri Lanka next week
Summary: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan will visit Sri Lanka on 23-24 February 2021 at the invitation of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa. The visit aims to strengthen bilateral ties between the two countries.

Title: Turkey Donates Ventilators and Protective Equipment to Sri Lanka to Address Covid-19 Challenges
Summary: Turkey has donated 10 ventilators and a shipment of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to Sri Lanka to help combat Covid-19 challenges. The donation was formally accepted by Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage from the Government of Turkey, presented by the Ambassador.

Title: Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents his letter of credence to the President of Moldova
Summary: Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa of Sri Lanka presented his letter of credence to the President of Moldova, with concurrent accreditation to the Russian Federation.

Title: UK Travel Restriction Lifted – Foreign Ministry
Summary: The UK travel restriction imposed by the Sri Lankan Government due to the new Covid-19 variant has been lifted immediately, according to the Foreign Ministry. Travel from the United Kingdom to Sri Lanka is now permitted.

Title: Message by Ambassador of  Sri Lanka to the Sultanate of Oman H.E. Omar Lebbe Ameer Ajwad  On The Commemoration of the 40th Anniversary of Diplomatic Relations between Sri Lanka and the Sultanate of Oman on 17 February 2021.
Summary: Today marks the 40th Anniversary of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and the Sultanate of Oman. To commemorate this milestone, Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka Hon. Dinesh Gunewardena and the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Oman H.E. Omar Lebbe Ameer Ajwad will participate in the celebrations on 17 February 2021.

Title: Providing continuous consular services to Sri Lankans in Milan
Summary: The Foreign Ministry will reintroduce the online appointment system for Sri Lankans at the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Milan, addressing concerns of the community in Italy. This move aims to provide continuous consular services to Sri Lankans residing in Milan.

Title: International Day Against the Use of Child Soldiers
Summary: The International Day Against the Use of Child Soldiers was marked with a virtual event focusing on implementing the Vancouver Principles to prevent and end the recruitment and use of child soldiers. H.E. Mohan Peiris, Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka, delivered a statement during the event.

Title: Sri Lanka and Japan conclude the 2nd Policy Dialogue virtually
Summary: Sri Lanka and Japan concluded their second Policy Dialogue virtually today, 10 February 2021. The dialogue took place at the Senior Official Level of the two Foreign Ministries, reflecting the strong foundation of political ties between the two countries.

Title: Interview of the Foreign Secretary on ´Pathikada’ telecast on Newsfirst Sri Lanka on 05 February 2021.
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage was interviewed on 'Pathikada' on Newsfirst Sri Lanka on 05 February 2021. During the interview, he discussed the upcoming 46th Session of the UNHRC and Sri Lanka's response to COVID-19.

Title: Foreign Ministry to open a Regional Consular Office in Kandy
Summary: The Foreign Ministry, under Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena's guidance, will open a Regional Consular Office in Kandy to support the Government's National Policy Framework, 'Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour', by improving consular services in the region. This initiative aims to enhance efficiency and effectiveness in serving the public.

Title: Independence Day speech by H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, the President of Sri Lanka at the 73rd Independence Day celebrations.
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered speeches in English, Sinhala, and Tamil during the 73rd Independence Day celebrations in Sri Lanka. The speeches highlighted key messages and priorities for the nation's future development and progress.

Title: Hon. Prime Minister’s Independence Day Message 2021
Summary: In his Independence Day message for 2021, the Honorable Prime Minister addressed the nation in English, Sinhala, and Tamil. The message aimed to inspire unity and progress among all citizens.

Title: Independence Day Message of the Hon. Foreign Minister – 2021
Summary: The Honorable Foreign Minister's Independence Day message for 2021 is available in English and Sinhala PDF formats, as well as in Tamil PD. The message conveys important sentiments and wishes for the occasion.

Title: The US Ambassador to Sri Lanka calls on the Foreign Minister
Summary: The US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Alaina B. Teplitz, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on February 2, 2021. State Minister for Regional Co-operation Tharaka Balasuriya also participated in the meeting held at the Foreign Ministry. The discussion likely focused on enhancing bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lankan maritime safety and security experts meet
Summary: Sri Lankan maritime safety and security experts recently gathered at the Lakshman Kadirgamar Institute, where Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage highlighted Sri Lanka's leadership role in the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA). The meeting aimed to strengthen collaboration and initiatives within the region.

Title: The Cabinet of Ministers approves the establishment of diplomatic relations with the Principality of Liechtenstein
Summary: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the establishment of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and the Principality of Liechtenstein. Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena submitted the proposal for this decision.

Title: Item 115 – Report of the Secretary-General on the work of the Organization  Plenary meeting of the 75th Session of the General Assembly
Summary: During the Plenary meeting of the 75th Session of the General Assembly, H.E. Mohan Peiris, the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations, delivered a statement on the Secretary-General's report on the organization's work. The statement was made on Friday, 29 January 2021, in the General Assembly Hall, marking an important contribution to the ongoing discussions.

Title: United Nations Security Council  Arria Formula Meeting on Children and Armed Conflict  Repatriation of children from conflict zones: from camps to homes. Call for action
Summary: The United Nations Security Council held an Arria Formula Meeting on repatriating children from conflict zones, emphasizing the transition from camps to homes. H.E. Mohan Peiris, Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative to the UN, called for action during the meeting on Friday, 29 January 2021.

Title: Ambassador Malraj de Silva Presents Credentials to the United Arab Emirates
Summary: Ambassador Malraj de Silva presented his Letters of Credence to Vice President and Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, at the Qasr Al Watan Presidential Palace. This formal ceremony marked the official beginning of Ambassador de Silva's diplomatic mission in the UAE.

Title: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to Egypt assumed duties
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador-designate to Egypt, M.K. Pathmanaathan, officially began his duties on January 25, 2020. He was warmly received at Cairo International Airport by a special representative.

Title: Foreign Secretary speaks on Sri Lanka’s foreign relations
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed Sri Lanka's foreign relations in an interview on News 1st NEWSLINE with Faraz Shauketaly on January 25, 2021. The interview can be viewed at the provided link.

Title: Special Notice by Sri Lanka Tourism
Summary: Sri Lanka Tourism has issued special instructions regarding entry permit categories for arrivals to Sri Lanka, following Ministry of Health guidelines dated 06 January 2021. Travelers are advised to adhere to these guidelines for entry into the country.

Title: 23rd meeting of the EU-Sri Lanka Joint Commission
Summary: The European Union (EU) and Sri Lanka convened their 23rd Joint Commission meeting on January 25, 2021, through a video conference. This marked the first Joint Commission meeting under the new leadership.

Title: Foreign Ministers of Sri Lanka and the Philippines agree to enhance diplomatic relations
Summary: Foreign Ministers of Sri Lanka and the Philippines agreed to enhance diplomatic relations by focusing on new strategies to strengthen economic, political, social, and international ties between the two countries. This agreement was reached during their meeting on the 22nd.

Title: Sri Lanka is Open for Tourist Arrivals: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena informs ACD Member States at the 17th Ministerial Meeting
Summary: At the 17th Ministerial Meeting of the Asia Cooperation Dialogue (ACD) on January 21, 2021, Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena announced that Sri Lanka is now open for tourist arrivals. The theme of the meeting was "New Normal and Safe and Healthy Tourism.

Title: Commission of Inquiry appointed to look into alleged human rights & IHL violations
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa appointed a three-member Commission of Inquiry (CoI) to investigate alleged human rights and IHL violations. The appointment was announced through a media release from the PMD on January 22, 2021, along with an Extraordinary Gazette notification.

Title: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to the State of Qatar, presents open Copy of his Letter of Credence
Summary: Ambassador-designate M. Mafaz Mohideen of Sri Lanka presented an open copy of his Letter of Credence to Qatar's Minister of State for Foreign Affairs, Soltan bin Saad.

Title: Ambassador – designate of Sri Lanka to Qatar Mafaz Mohideen assumes duties in Doha
Summary: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to Qatar, Mohamed Mafaz Mohideen, officially started his duties at the Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha on January 17, 2021. The commencement was commemorated with a simple ceremony.

Title: High Commissioner Kananathan presents credentials to UN Office in Nairobi
Summary: High Commissioner V. Kananathan of Sri Lanka to Kenya presented his credentials to the United Nations Office in Nairobi. He is also accredited as the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to UNON, UN Habitat, and United Nations.

Title: Ambassador- designate of Sri Lanka to French Republic and Permanent Delegation of UNESCO assumed duties
Summary: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to the French Republic and Permanent Delegation of UNESCO, Professor Kshanika Hirimburegama, assumed duties on January 8, 2021, in Paris. The Sri Lankan National Flag was hoisted by the Ambassador during the ceremony.

Title: Sri Lanka to commence flights to Myanmar
Summary: Sri Lanka plans to start charter flights to Myanmar from mid-2021, as announced by Mohan Meegolla, the Regional Manager (Southeast Asia) of Sri Lankan Airlines, during a meeting organized by the Foreign Ministry. This initiative aims to boost air travel between the two countries post COVID-19.

Title: Thai Pongal Message of H.E. the President
Summary: H.E. the President delivers Thai Pongal messages in English, Sinhala, and Tamil to the nation. The messages convey warm wishes and blessings for the Thai Pongal festival celebrations.

Title: Viet Nam Sri Lanka Cooperation focus on Agriculture and Fisheries Sectors
Summary: Viet Nam's Ambassador in Colombo, Pham Thi Bich Ngoc, highlighted the significant potential for cooperation between Sri Lanka and Viet Nam in agriculture and fisheries sectors during a recent meeting with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on January 12, 2021. The discussion emphasized the mutual interest in enhancing collaboration between the two countries in these key areas.

Title: Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona presents copy of the credentials to the Director General of the Department of Protocol of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China, Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona, formally presented his credentials to the Director General of the Department of Protocol, Hong Lei, in accordance with protocol. This gesture signifies the official recognition of Dr. Kohona's role in representing Sri Lanka in diplomatic relations with China.

Title: Foreign Minister seeks assistance to boost FDIs from Honorary Consuls based in Colombo
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena asked Honorary Consuls in Colombo to help attract foreign investors to Sri Lanka. He made the request during a meeting held on January 11th to boost Foreign Direct Investments (FDIs) in the country.

Title: Conferring of the Honorary Religious Title “Aggamahāpaṇḍita” on the four Sri Lankan Buddhist Priests
Summary: The President of Myanmar, U Win Myint, will confer the Honorary Religious Title "Aggamahāpaṇḍita" on four Sri Lankan Buddhist monks. Additionally, three Buddhist Priests and one Layman will receive several other Honorary Titles. This decision highlights the recognition and honor bestowed upon these individuals by the President of Myanmar.

Title: Appointment of the High Commissioner of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Bangladesh, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Tareq Md. Ariful Islam as the High Commissioner of Bangladesh to Sri Lanka.

Title: Thailand to focus on investment opportunities in Plantation and Agricultural sectors in Sri Lanka
Summary: Thailand's Ambassador in Sri Lanka, Chulamanee Chartsuwan, paid a Farewell Call on Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on 08 January 2021. They discussed Thailand's interest in exploring investment opportunities in Sri Lanka's Plantation and Agricultural sectors.

Title: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena assures the early resumption of medical tourism for Seychellois
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with the outgoing High Commissioner of Seychelles, Conrad Vincent Mederic, at the Foreign Ministry on January 8, 2021. During the meeting, Gunawardena assured the early resumption of medical tourism for Seychellois, emphasizing the importance of the sector for both countries.

Title: Repatriation Process “People Centric and Transparent” – Foreign Ministry sets the record straight
Summary: The Foreign Ministry clarified that the repatriation process is people-centric and transparent, with no financial burden on Sri Lankans. Foreign Secretary Jayanath Colombage emphasized this in response to misinformation circulating in the public domain.

Title: Foreign Minister Gunawardena seeks to re-open employment opportunities in Korea
Summary: Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Korean Ambassador Woonjin Jeong on January 4 to discuss reviving foreign employment cooperation between Sri Lanka and South Korea. Gunawardena aims to re-open employment opportunities for Sri Lankans in Korea.

Title: Sri Lanka Ambassador-Designate to Japan assumed duties
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador-Designate to Japan, Sanjiv Gunasekara, officially began his duties on January 6, 2021, in Tokyo. He is the seventeenth Sri Lankan Ambassador to Japan in the 69-year history of bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: “India will always be a dependable partner and reliable friend open to strengthening its relationship with Sri Lanka” says EAM Dr. S. Jaishankar
Summary: During his visit, Indian Minister of External Affairs Dr. S. Jaishankar engaged in bilateral talks with Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Republic Building on January 6, 2021. Dr. Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to being a reliable partner and expressed openness to enhancing the relationship with Sri Lanka.

Title: Media statement made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister following his Bilateral Talks with the visiting Indian Minister of External Affairs Dr. S. Jaishankar on 6th January 2021 at the Foreign Ministry
Summary: Foreign Minister Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena issued a media statement after holding bilateral talks with Indian Minister of External Affairs Dr. S. Jaishankar on January 6, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry. The meeting included discussions with H.E. Mr. Gopal Baglay, the Indian High Commissioner, and other Indian officials.

Title: UNDP Human Development Report presented to the Foreign Minister
Summary: UNDP Resident Coordinator Robert Jukham presented the UNDP Human Development Report 2020 to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on January 5, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry. Foreign Minister Gunawardena expressed appreciation for the report during the presentation.

Title: Foreign Secretary Colombage speaks of the repatriation process and the revival of tourism
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed the repatriation process for Sri Lankan nationals abroad and the plans for reviving the tourism industry in an interview on Sirasa TV1 on January 5, 2021. He highlighted the importance of facilitating the return of citizens and boosting tourism to support the country's economy.

Title: Foreign Secretary Colombage speaks of repatriation, revival of tourism and obtaining vaccines for COVID-19
Summary: Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed the repatriation of Sri Lankans, quarantine facilities, and plans for reviving tourism and securing COVID-19 vaccines during an interview on Ada Derana's 'Big Focus' on January 4, 2021. He highlighted efforts to facilitate the return of citizens, ensure proper quarantine measures, and boost the tourism sector amidst the pandemic.

Title: Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S.Jaishankar undertakes his first New Year foreign visit to Sri Lanka from 5th to 7th January 2021
Summary: Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar will visit Sri Lanka from January 5th to 7th, 2021, at the invitation of Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena. This marks Dr. Jaishankar's first foreign visit of the New Year.

Title: Sri Lanka extends felicitations on Cuban National Day
Summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena visited the Cuban Embassy in Colombo to extend felicitations on the occasion of Cuban National Day, which took place on January 1, 2021. He conveyed best wishes to Ambassador Juana Elena Ramos Rodriguez during the visit.

Title: 68,000 Sri Lankans awaiting return – Foreign Secretary
Summary: Foreign Secretary reports that 68,000 Sri Lankans are awaiting repatriation amid the global Covid pandemic. The Foreign Ministry is leading efforts to address this pressing challenge.

Title: Let us unite and dedicate ourselves for the betterment of our Motherland – Foreign Minister Gunawardena
Summary: Foreign Minister Gunawardena calls for unity among Sri Lankans in 2021 to protect the country's dignity, independence, sovereignty, and territorial integrity. He emphasizes the importance of working together for the betterment of the Motherland.

Title: President’s New Year Message
Summary: President's New Year Message is now available for download in English, Sinhala, and Tamil. You can access the message in PDF format for a detailed review. Wishing everyone a prosperous New Year ahead.
